pButton.Name: WWI
pButton.popInfo: One of the effects of imperialism was the tension it caused between imperial nations due to military and economic competition. This tension was a contributing factor leading up to World War I.

pButton.Name: COLONIAL PEOPLES
pButton.popInfo: A tragic effect of imperialism on African colonies was the tremendous suffering and loss of life among Africa’s indigenous peoples.

pButton.Name: ECONOMICS
pButton.popInfo: Modern economic research indicates that the European empires gained very few net economic benefits from imperialism given the tremendous costs of maintaining an empire.

pButton.Name: WWII
pButton.popInfo: The devastation of Europe as a result of World War II and rising nationalism in the colonies led to the end of Europe’s empires in Africa and Asia.

pButton.Name: DECOLONIZATION
pButton.popInfo: By the 1960s, virtually all former colonies in Africa and Asia had achieved independence although they maintained economic and cultural ties with their former rulers to varying degrees.
